intro: Filago nuttallii, commonly known as Nuttall's filago, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as prairies and rocky slopes. It has slender stems and small, narrow leaves, and its flowers are usually yellow or white. Filago nuttallii is often found in dry, disturbed areas and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
